sentences.zh: 昔自在古，歷建正作於孟春。

translations.literal: In ancient times, calendars established the first month to begin in spring.

sentences.zh: 於時冰泮發蟄，百草奮興，秭鳺先滜。

translations.literal: At this season, ice melts and hibernating creatures stir, a hundred plants burst forth vigorously, and the phoenix appears first.

sentences.zh: 物乃歲具，生於東，次順四時，卒于冬分。

translations.literal: All things thus complete their yearly cycle: born in the east, they follow the four seasons in sequence, ending at the winter solstice.
The cock crows thrice, and then daylight comes.
Following the twelve monthly divisions, it ends at the chou earthly branch.
Sun and moon achieve completion, hence brightness.

sentences.zh: 明者孟也，幽者幼也，幽明者雌雄也。

translations.literal: Brightness means primacy, darkness means youth; darkness and brightness are the female and male principles.

sentences.zh: 雌雄代興，而順至正之統也。

translations.literal: Male and female alternate in ascendancy, thus following the supreme order of correctness.
Sun returns to the west, rises bright in the east;
translations.idiomatic: The sun sets in the west, rising brightly in the east;

translations.literal: the moon sets in the east, rising brightly in the west.

sentences.zh: 正不率天，又不由人，則凡事易壞而難成矣。

translations.literal: If the calendar neither follows heaven nor is established by human convention, then all undertakings easily fail and are difficult to accomplish.

In ancient times, the calendar established the first month and began in spring. At this time ice melts and hibernating creatures emerge, the hundred plants flourish vigorously, the phoenix first appears. Things then complete the year, born in the east, then follow the four seasons in order, end at winter solstice. The cock crows thrice, then it becomes bright. Following the twelve monthly divisions, ends at chou. Sun and moon are complete, therefore bright. Bright means first, dark means young, dark and bright are female and male. Female and male alternate in flourishing, thus following the supreme correct principle. Sun returns to the west, rises bright in the east; Moon returns to the east, rises bright in the west. If the calendar does not follow heaven, nor is established by man, then all affairs easily spoil and are hard to accomplish.

sentences.zh: 王者易姓受命，必慎始初，改正朔，易服色，推本天元，順承厥意。

translations.literal: When kings change surname and receive the mandate, they must be careful at the beginning, change the first day of the month, change clothing colors, trace back to heaven's origin, follow and receive its intent.
translations.idiomatic: When kings change their clan name and receive the mandate, they must be careful at the outset: change the beginning of the month, alter the colors of clothing, trace back to heaven's primal origin, and follow its intentions.

translations.literal: When kings change surname and receive the mandate, they must be careful at the beginning, change the first day of the month, change clothing colors, trace back to heaven's origin, follow and receive its intent.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：神農以前尚矣。

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: Before Shennong it is still ancient.
translations.idiomatic: Sima Qian remarks: The period before Shennong is exceedingly ancient.

sentences.zh: 蓋黃帝考定星歷，建立五行，起消息，正閏餘，於是有天地神祇物類之官，是謂五官。

translations.literal: The Yellow Emperor examined and fixed the stars and calendar, established the five elements, initiated the cycles of growth and decline, corrected the intercalary months. Thus there came to be officials overseeing heaven, earth, spirits, and natural categories—these are called the five officials.
Each manages its proper sequence without mutual confusion.

sentences.zh: 民是以能有信，神是以能有明德。

translations.literal: The people thus could have faith; the spirits thus could manifest bright virtue.

sentences.zh: 民神異業，敬而不瀆，故神降之嘉生，民以物享，災禍不生，所求不匱。

translations.literal: People and spirits have different callings; they maintain respectful distance without sacrilege. Therefore spirits send down auspicious progeny, people offer sacrifices, disasters do not arise, and needs are fully met.

The Grand Historian says: Before Shennong it is still ancient. The Yellow Emperor examined and determined the stars and calendar, established the five elements, initiated waxing and waning, corrected leap months, thus there were officials for heaven, earth, spirits, and things, called the five officials. Each manages its sequence, not mutually chaotic. The people thus could have faith, the spirits thus could have bright virtue. People and spirits have different occupations, respectful and not profane, therefore spirits send down auspicious births, people offer things in sacrifice, disasters do not arise, what is sought is not lacking.

sentences.zh: 少暤氏之衰也，九黎亂德，民神雜擾，不可放物，禍菑薦至，莫盡其氣。

translations.literal: When the Shaohao line declined, the Nine Li corrupted virtue. People and spirits mixed in chaos, unable to properly release their vital forces. Calamities arrived repeatedly, and none completed their natural lifespan.

sentences.zh: 顓頊受之，乃命南正重司天以屬神，命火正黎司地以屬民，使復舊常，無相侵瀆。

translations.literal: Zhuanxu received this legacy and commanded Nan Zheng Chong to oversee heaven and serve the spirits, Huo Zheng Li to oversee earth and serve the people, restoring them to ancient customs without mutual violation or sacrilege.

When Shaohao declined, the Nine Li confused virtue, people and spirits mixed in disturbance, could not release things, calamities repeatedly arrived, none completed their lifespan. Zhuanxu received it, then commanded Nan Zheng Chong to oversee heaven and belong to spirits, commanded Huo Zheng Li to oversee earth and belong to people, causing them to return to old customs, without mutual invasion and profanity.

sentences.zh: 其後三苗服九黎之德，故二官咸廢所職，而閏餘乖次，孟陬殄滅，攝提無紀，歷數失序。

translations.literal: Afterwards the Three Miao followed the Nine Li's virtue, therefore the two officials all abandoned their duties, leap months lost sequence, first month extinguished, Sheti without record, calendar numbers lost order.
translations.idiomatic: Later, the Three Miao adopted the Nine Li's corrupted virtue. Thus both officials abandoned their duties, intercalary months lost their sequence, the first month was obliterated, the guiding asterism had no record, and the calendar lost all order.

sentences.zh: 堯復遂重黎之後，不忘舊者，使復典之，而立羲和之官。

translations.literal: Yao again continued Chong and Li's posterity, not forgetting the old, caused them to again oversee it, and established the Xi and He officials.
translations.idiomatic: Yao again continued the line of Chong and Li, not forgetting the old ways. He had them resume their oversight and established the offices of Xi and He.

sentences.zh: 明時正度，則陰陽調，風雨節，茂氣至，民無夭疫。

translations.literal: When seasons are clearly marked and measures properly regulated, yin and yang harmonize, wind and rain come in moderation, abundant vital energy arrives, and people suffer no premature epidemics.

sentences.zh: 年耆禪舜，申戒文祖，云「天之歷數在爾躬」。

translations.literal: When old, Yao yielded to Shun, declared to Wen Zu, saying 'Heaven's calendar numbers are in your person'.
translations.idiomatic: When aged, Yao yielded to Shun and solemnly instructed Wen Zu: "Heaven's calendar rests upon your person."

translations.literal: Shun in turn commanded Yu thus.
From this we see how highly kings valued the calendar.

Afterwards the Three Miao followed the Nine Li's virtue, therefore the two officials all abandoned their duties, leap months lost sequence, first month extinguished, Sheti without record, calendar numbers lost order. Yao again continued Chong and Li's posterity, not forgetting the old, caused them to again oversee it, and established the Xi and He officials. Make the seasons clear and measures correct, then yin and yang harmonize, wind and rain moderate, abundant qi arrives, people have no premature epidemics. When old, Yao yielded to Shun, declared to Wen Zu, saying 'Heaven's calendar numbers are in your person'. Shun also commanded Yu thus. From this we see, it is what kings value.

sentences.zh: 夏正以正月，殷正以十二月，周正以十一月。

translations.literal: The Xia dynasty took the first month as the beginning, the Yin dynasty took the twelfth month as the beginning, the Zhou dynasty took the eleventh month as the beginning.

sentences.zh: 蓋三王之正若循環，窮則反本。

translations.literal: The three kings' zheng are like cycling, when exhausted then return to the root.
translations.idiomatic: The three dynasties' beginnings cycle like a wheel—when one completes, it returns to the root.

translations.literal: When the world has the Way, then does not lose the calendar order;
translations.idiomatic: When the world follows the Way, the calendar maintains its proper order;

sentences.zh: 無道，則正朔不行於諸侯。

translations.literal: when without the Way, the calendar's first day finds no acceptance among the feudal lords.

Xia calendar takes the first month as zheng, Yin calendar takes the twelfth month as zheng, Zhou calendar takes the eleventh month as zheng. The three kings' zheng are like cycling, when exhausted then return to the root. When the world has the Way, then does not lose the calendar order; when without the Way, then zheng and shuo do not circulate among the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 幽、厲之後，周室微，陪臣執政，史不記時，君不告朔，故疇人子弟分散，或在諸夏，或在夷狄，是以其禨祥廢而不統。

translations.literal: After You and Li, the Zhou house declined, ministers in attendance took power, historians did not record time, lords did not announce the first day, therefore the calendar officials' sons dispersed, some in the various Xia, some among the Yi and Di, therefore their good and evil omens were abandoned and not unified.
translations.idiomatic: After the reigns of You and Li, the Zhou house weakened. High ministers seized power, historians failed to record the seasons, lords neglected to announce the new moon. Thus the calendar officials' sons scattered—some among the Chinese states, others among the barbarian tribes—so their auspicious and inauspicious signs were abandoned and fell into disunity.

sentences.zh: 周襄王二十六年閏三月，而春秋非之。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year of King Xiang of Zhou, there was an intercalary third month, which the Spring and Autumn Annals condemned.

sentences.zh: 先王之正時也，履端於始，舉正於中，歸邪於終。

translations.literal: The former kings' correcting time: tread the beginning at the start, raise the correct at the middle, return the intercalary at the end.
translations.idiomatic: The former kings' regulation of time: they stepped upon the beginning at the start, upheld correctness in the middle, and relegated irregularities to the end.

translations.literal: Tread the beginning at the start, sequence then does not err;
translations.idiomatic: Stepping upon the beginning at the start ensures sequence never errs;

translations.literal: raise the correct at the middle, people then are not confused;
translations.idiomatic: upholding correctness in the middle ensures the people are never confused;

translations.literal: relegating irregularities to the end ensures affairs proceed without contradiction.

After You and Li, the Zhou house declined, ministers in attendance took power, historians did not record time, lords did not announce the first day, therefore the calendar officials' sons dispersed, some in the various Xia, some among the Yi and Di, therefore their good and evil omens were abandoned and not unified. Zhou Xiang Wang twenty-sixth year had an intercalary third month, and the Spring and Autumn Annals condemned it. The former kings' correcting time: tread the beginning at the start, raise the correct at the middle, return the intercalary at the end. Tread the beginning at the start, sequence then does not err; raise the correct at the middle, people then are not confused; return the intercalary at the end, affairs then are not contrary.

sentences.zh: 其後戰國并爭，在於彊國禽敵，救急解紛而已，豈遑念斯哉！

translations.literal: Afterwards the Warring States contended together, lay in strong states capturing enemies, rescuing urgencies and resolving disputes only, how could they have leisure to think of this!
translations.idiomatic: In the later Warring States period, states contended fiercely, focused solely on powerful nations defeating enemies and resolving urgent disputes. How could they have leisure for such matters?

sentences.zh: 是時獨有鄒衍，明於五德之傳，而散消息之分，以顯諸侯。

translations.literal: Only Zou Yan at this time understood the transmission of the five virtues, dispersing knowledge of the divisions between growth and decline to enlighten the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 而亦因秦滅六國，兵戎極煩，又升至尊之日淺，未暇遑也。

translations.literal: But Qin had just extinguished the six states amid extreme military turmoil, and the First Emperor's ascent to supreme power was recent—he had no leisure for this.

sentences.zh: 而亦頗推五勝，而自以為獲水德之瑞，更名河曰「德水」，而正以十月，色上黑。

translations.literal: And also somewhat pushed the five victories, and considered himself to have obtained the water virtue omen, changed the name of the river to 'Virtue Water', and corrected with the tenth month, color above black.
translations.idiomatic: Yet he somewhat advanced the theory of five victories, considering himself to have received the omen of water virtue. He renamed the Yellow River "Virtue River," established the tenth month as the beginning, and took black as the ruling color.

sentences.zh: 然歷度閏餘，未能睹其真也。

translations.literal: However, regarding calendar measurements and intercalary months, he could not discern their true principles.

Afterwards the Warring States contended together, lay in strong states capturing enemies, rescuing urgencies and resolving disputes only, how could they have leisure to think of this! At this time only Zou Yan was clear about the transmission of the five virtues, and dispersed the divisions of waxing and waning, to make them manifest to the feudal lords. And also because Qin extinguished the six states, weapons extremely troublesome, moreover ascending to the supreme position was recent, had no leisure. And also somewhat pushed the five victories, and considered himself to have obtained the water virtue omen, changed the name of the river to 'Virtue Water', and corrected with the tenth month, color above black. However, calendar degrees and leap months, could not see their truth.

sentences.zh: 漢興，高祖曰「北畤待我而起」，亦自以為獲水德之瑞。

translations.literal: When Han arose, Gaozu said 'The northern altar awaits me to rise', also considered himself to have obtained the water virtue omen.
translations.idiomatic: When the Han arose, Gaozu declared: "The northern altar awaits my rise," also considering himself to have received the water virtue omen.

sentences.zh: 雖明習歷及張蒼等，咸以為然。

translations.literal: Even those well-versed in calendars like Zhang Cang and others all agreed.

sentences.zh: 是時天下初定，方綱紀大基，高后女主，皆未遑，故襲秦正朔服色。

translations.literal: At this time the empire was newly pacified, just laying the great foundations of law and order. With Empress Gao as female ruler, none had leisure for change, so they followed Qin's calendar and colors.

When Han arose, Gaozu said 'The northern altar awaits me to rise', also considered himself to have obtained the water virtue omen. Though clearly practiced in calendars like Zhang Cang and others, all considered it so. At this time the world was first pacified, just establishing the great foundation of laws and discipline, Empress Gao was female ruler, all had no leisure, therefore followed Qin zheng and shuo clothing colors.

sentences.zh: 至孝文時，魯人公孫臣以終始五德上書，言「漢得土德，宜更元，改正朔，易服色。

translations.literal: When it reached Emperor Wen's time, the Lu man Gongsun Chen presented a memorial with the five virtues end and beginning, saying 'Han obtains earth virtue, should change the yuan, correct zheng and shuo, change clothing colors.
translations.idiomatic: When Emperor Wen's reign arrived, Gongsun Chen of Lu presented a memorial on the cycle of five virtues, stating: "Han has obtained earth virtue and should change the era name, correct the calendar beginnings, and alter the clothing colors.

translations.literal: Should have an omen, the yellow dragon appears as omen'.
translations.idiomatic: There should be an omen—a yellow dragon will appear."

sentences.zh: 事下丞相張蒼，張蒼亦學律歷，以為非是，罷之。

translations.literal: The matter was referred to Chancellor Zhang Cang, who also studied pitch pipes and calendars. He considered it incorrect and dismissed it.

sentences.zh: 其後黃龍見成紀，張蒼自黜，所欲論著不成。

translations.literal: Later a yellow dragon appeared in Chengji. Zhang Cang demoted himself, and his scholarly ambitions went unrealized.

sentences.zh: 而新垣平以望氣見，頗言正歷服色事，貴幸，後作亂，故孝文帝廢不復問。

translations.literal: Xinyuan Ping gained favor through observing vital energies and often spoke of calendar and color matters. He became honored and trusted, but later rebelled. Therefore Emperor Wen abandoned the topic and never revisited it.

When it reached Emperor Wen's time, the Lu man Gongsun Chen presented a memorial with the five virtues end and beginning, saying 'Han obtains earth virtue, should change the yuan, correct zheng and shuo, change clothing colors. Should have an omen, the yellow dragon appears as omen'. The matter was sent down to Chancellor Zhang Cang, Zhang Cang also studied pitch pipes and calendars, considered it not correct, dismissed it. Afterwards the yellow dragon appeared in Chengji, Zhang Cang self-demoted, his desired writings were not accomplished. And Xinyuan Ping by observing qi was seen, quite spoke of calendar and clothing color matters, was honored and favored, afterwards made rebellion, therefore Emperor Wen abandoned and did not again ask.

sentences.zh: 至今上即位，招致方士唐都，分其天部；

translations.literal: Until the present emperor ascended the throne, summoned the fangshi Tang Du, divided his heaven department;
translations.idiomatic: When the current emperor ascended, he summoned the fangshi Tang Du and assigned him the department of heaven;

sentences.zh: 而巴落下閎運算轉歷，然後日辰之度與夏正同。

translations.literal: Ba Xianjun Xiahou An calculated and reformed the calendar, making the degrees of days and earthly branches match the Xia dynasty's system.
Thus he changed the era name, altered official titles, and performed the Feng sacrifice at Mount Tai.

sentences.zh: 因詔御史曰：「乃者，有司言星度之未定也，廣延宣問，以理星度，未能詹也。

translations.literal: Then commanded the Imperial Secretary saying: 'Recently, the officials spoke of the star degrees not yet determined, extensively invited and asked, to reason the star degrees, could not reach them.
translations.idiomatic: He then commanded the imperial secretary: "Recently officials reported that the degrees of the stars remain undetermined. We extensively consulted experts and sought explanations for the stellar degrees, but could not resolve them.

sentences.zh: 蓋聞昔者黃帝合而不死，名察度驗，定清濁，起五部，建氣物分數。

translations.literal: I have heard that in ancient times the Yellow Emperor achieved harmony and immortality. He named and examined the degrees and their proofs, determined clear and turbid distinctions, established the five divisions, and constructed the categories and numbers for vital energies and phenomena.
Yet this is exceedingly ancient.
The classics are incomplete and music has declined—I deeply regret this.

sentences.zh: 朕唯未能循明也，紬績日分，率應水德之勝。

translations.literal: I only have not been able to follow brightness, continue the daily divisions, follow responding to water virtue's victory.
translations.idiomatic: I have only been unable to follow the path of enlightenment. I continue the daily divisions in accordance with water virtue's victory.

sentences.zh: 今日順夏至，黃鐘為宮，林鐘為徵，太蔟為商，南呂為羽，姑洗為角。

translations.literal: Today follow summer solstice, Huangzhong as gong, Linzhong as zhi, Taicu as shang, Nanlü as yu, Guxi as jiao.
translations.idiomatic: Today we follow the summer solstice: Huangzhong serves as gong, Linzhong as zhi, Taicu as shang, Nanlü as yu, Guxi as jiao.

sentences.zh: 自是以後，氣復正，羽聲復清，名復正變，以至子日當冬至，則陰陽離合之道行焉。

translations.literal: From this point forward, the vital energies return to correctness, the yu tone regains clarity, names return to proper transformations. When the zi day coincides with winter solstice, the way of yin and yang separating and uniting proceeds.

sentences.zh: 十一月甲子朔旦冬至已詹，其更以七年為太初元年。

translations.literal: The eleventh month jiazi day has a new moon at dawn with winter solstice achieved. Moreover, we change to make the seventh year Taichu first year.

sentences.zh: 年名『焉逢攝提格』，月名『畢聚』，日得甲子，夜半朔旦冬至。」

translations.literal: Year named 'Yanfeng Shetige', month named 'Bijue', day gets jiazi, midnight new moon dawn winter solstice.'
translations.idiomatic: The year is named 'Yanfeng Shetige,' the month 'Bijue,' the day obtains jiazi, midnight new moon dawn winter solstice."

translations.literal: Until the present emperor ascended the throne, summoned the fangshi Tang Du, divided his heaven department; and Ba Xianjun Xiahou An calculated and rotated the calendar, then the degrees of days and branches were the same as Xia zheng. Then changed the yuan, changed official titles, sealed Mount Tai. Then commanded the Imperial Secretary saying: 'Recently, the officials spoke of the star degrees not yet determined, extensively invited and asked, to reason the star degrees, could not reach them. I have heard that in former times the Yellow Emperor harmonized and did not die, named and examined degrees and proofs, determined clear and turbid, established the five divisions, built qi and things divisions and numbers. However, it is still ancient. Books lacking and music relaxed, I deeply pity it. I only have not been able to follow brightness, continue the daily divisions, follow responding to water virtue's victory. Today follow summer solstice, Huangzhong as gong, Linzhong as zhi, Taicu as shang, Nanlü as yu, Guxi as jiao. From this afterward, qi returns correct, yu sound returns clear, names return correct transformations, until zi day should be winter solstice, then the way of yin and yang separating and combining proceeds. Eleventh month jiazi new moon dawn winter solstice has been reached, moreover change to make seven years as Taichu first year. Year named 'Yanfeng Shetige', month named 'Bijue', day gets jiazi, midnight new moon dawn winter solstice.'

sentences.zh: 歷術甲子篇太初元年，歲名「焉逢攝提格」，月名「畢聚」，日得甲子，夜半朔旦冬至。

translations.literal: Calendar method Jiazi chapter Taichu first year, year named 'Yanfeng Shetige', month named 'Bijue', day gets jiazi, midnight new moon dawn winter solstice.
translations.idiomatic: Calendar Methods Jiazi Chapter: Taichu first year, year named "Yanfeng Shetige," month named "Bijue," day obtains jiazi, midnight new moon dawn winter solstice.

translations.literal: Calendar method Jiazi chapter Taichu first year, year named 'Yanfeng Shetige', month named 'Bijue', day gets jiazi, midnight new moon dawn winter solstice.

sentences.zh: 正北十二無大餘，無小餘；

translations.literal: Zheng north twelve no major remainder, no minor remainder;
translations.idiomatic: Due north twelve: no major remainder, no minor remainder;

translations.literal: no major remainder, no minor remainder;
translations.idiomatic: no major remainder, no minor remainder.

translations.literal: Yanfeng Shetige, Taichu first year.
Zheng north twelve no major remainder, no minor remainder; no major remainder, no minor remainder; Yanfeng Shetige Taichu first year.

sentences.zh: 十二大餘五十四，小餘三百四十八；

translations.literal: Twelve major remainder fifty-four, minor remainder three hundred forty-eight;
translations.idiomatic: Twelve: major remainder fifty-four, minor remainder three hundred forty-eight;

translations.literal: major remainder five, minor remainder eight;
translations.idiomatic: major remainder: five; minor remainder: eight.

translations.literal: Duanmeng Shanhe, second year.
Twelve major remainder fifty-four, minor remainder three hundred forty-eight; major remainder five, minor remainder eight; Duanmeng Shanhe second year.

sentences.zh: 閏十三大餘四十八，小餘六百九十六；

translations.literal: Intercalary thirteen major remainder forty-eight, minor remainder six hundred ninety-six;
translations.idiomatic: Intercalary thirteen: major remainder forty-eight, minor remainder six hundred ninety-six;

translations.literal: major remainder ten, minor remainder sixteen;
translations.idiomatic: major remainder: ten; minor remainder: sixteen.

translations.literal: Youzhao Zhixu, third year.
Intercalary thirteen major remainder forty-eight, minor remainder six hundred ninety-six; major remainder ten, minor remainder sixteen; Youzhao Zhixu third year.

sentences.zh: 十二大餘十二，小餘六百三；

translations.literal: Twelve major remainder twelve, minor remainder six hundred three;
translations.idiomatic: Twelve: major remainder twelve, minor remainder six hundred three;

translations.literal: major remainder fifteen, minor remainder twenty-four;
translations.idiomatic: major remainder: fifteen; minor remainder: twenty-four.

translations.literal: Jiangwu Dahuangluo, fourth year.
Twelve major remainder twelve, minor remainder six hundred three; major remainder fifteen, minor remainder twenty-four; Jiangwu Dahuangluo fourth year.
Twelve major remainder seven, minor remainder eleven;
translations.idiomatic: Twelve: major remainder seven, minor remainder eleven;

translations.literal: major remainder twenty-one, no minor remainder;
translations.idiomatic: major remainder: twenty-one; no minor remainder.

translations.literal: Tuwei Dunzhang, Tianhan first year.
Twelve major remainder seven, minor remainder eleven; major remainder twenty-one, no minor remainder; Tuwei Dunzhang Tianhan first year.

sentences.zh: 閏十三大餘一，小餘三百五十九；

translations.literal: Intercalary thirteen major remainder one, minor remainder three hundred fifty-nine;
translations.idiomatic: Intercalary thirteen: major remainder one, minor remainder three hundred fifty-nine;

translations.literal: major remainder twenty-six, minor remainder eight;
translations.idiomatic: major remainder: twenty-six; minor remainder: eight.

translations.literal: Zhuli Xieqia, second year.
Intercalary thirteen major remainder one, minor remainder three hundred fifty-nine; major remainder twenty-six, minor remainder eight; Zhuli Xieqia second year.

sentences.zh: 十二大餘二十五，小餘二百六十六；

translations.literal: Twelve major remainder twenty-five, minor remainder two hundred sixty-six;
translations.idiomatic: Twelve: major remainder twenty-five, minor remainder two hundred sixty-six;

translations.literal: major remainder thirty-one, minor remainder sixteen;
translations.idiomatic: major remainder: thirty-one; minor remainder: sixteen.

translations.literal: Shangheng Zitang, third year.
Twelve major remainder twenty-five, minor remainder two hundred sixty-six; major remainder thirty-one, minor remainder sixteen; Shangheng Zitang third year.

sentences.zh: 十二大餘十九，小餘六百一十四；

translations.literal: Twelve major remainder nineteen, minor remainder six hundred fourteen;
translations.idiomatic: Twelve: major remainder nineteen, minor remainder six hundred fourteen;

sentences.zh: 大餘三十六，小餘二十四；

translations.literal: major remainder thirty-six, minor remainder twenty-four;
translations.idiomatic: major remainder: thirty-six; minor remainder: twenty-four.

translations.literal: Zhaoyang Zuoe, fourth year.
Twelve major remainder nineteen, minor remainder six hundred fourteen; major remainder thirty-six, minor remainder twenty-four; Zhaoyang Zuoe fourth year.

The above is the calendar book: major remainder is the day.
translations.idiomatic: The above is the calendar book: the major remainder represents the day.

translations.literal: The minor remainder represents the month.
Duanneng is the year name.

sentences.zh: 支：丑名赤奮若，寅名攝提格。

translations.literal: Branch: Chou is named Chifengruo, Yin is named Shetige.
translations.idiomatic: Branches: Chou is named Chifengruo, Yin is named Shetige.

translations.literal: Stem: Bing is named Youzhao.
translations.idiomatic: Stems: Bing is named Youzhao.

translations.literal: Zheng north, winter solstice adds zi time;
translations.idiomatic: Due north, winter solstice adds zi time;

translations.literal: Zheng west, adds you time;
translations.idiomatic: due west, adds you time;

translations.literal: Zheng south, adds wu time;
translations.idiomatic: due south, adds wu time;

translations.literal: due east, adds mao time.

The above is the calendar book: major remainder is the day. Minor remainder is the month. Duanneng is the year name. Branch: Chou is named Chifengruo, Yin is named Shetige. Stem: Bing is named Youzhao. Zheng north, winter solstice adds zi time; Zheng west, adds you time; Zheng south, adds wu time; Zheng east, adds mao time.
